properties.description: Non-material amendment to planning permission ref: 2019/01880/VAR granted 19th May 2020 to update the wording of conditions 19 and 23.  Condition 19 to be updated to include reference to the Energy Strategy approved under application 2022/00404/DET.  Condition 23 to be updated to omit paragraph A and to read as follows: 'If any new diesel fuelled generators and their abatement technologies are installed in the development hereby approved, prior to their operation details demonstrating compliance with a minimum NOx emissions standard of 100 mg/Nm-3 (at 15% O2) must be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. During the operation of the generators there must be no persistent visible emission. Where any combustion plant does not meet the relevant standard, it should not be operated without the fitting of suitable NOx abatement equipment or technology. Evidence of installation shall be required where secondary abatement is required to meet the NOx Emission standard mg/Nm-3. The submitted details must include the results of NOx emissions testing of the diesel fuelled generator units by an accredited laboratory and where secondary abatement is used to meet that NOx emissions standard of 100 mg/Nm-3 it is met within 5 minutes of the generator commencing operation. The maintenance and cleaning of the systems shall be undertaken regularly in accordance with manufacturer specifications. The diesel fuelled generators shall only be used for a maximum of 48 hours when there is a sustained interruption in the mains power supply to the site, and the testing of these diesel generators shall not exceed a maximum of 36 hours per calendar year. Approved details shall be fully implemented and thereafter permanently retained and maintained.'

The diesel fuelled generators shall only be used for a maximum of 48 hours when there is a sustained interruption in the mains power supply to the site, and the testing of these diesel generators shall not exceed a maximum of 36 hours per calendar year. properties.description: Redevelopment of the former B&Q Retail Warehouse site (western part of the site only - Identified as Buildings A and C) for the construction of 7 residential blocks ranging from 13 to 19 storeys to provide a mixed use scheme including 413 residential units (Class C3) and ancillary residential facilities in association with 'Build to Rent', 1,205m² flexible commercial floorspace (Class E, Sui Generis), with car/cycle parking (9 blue badge spaces) , associated combined heat and power (CHP), plant and associated works, landscaping, and offsite highways works including a new pedestrian crossing on Swandon Way. An Environmental Statement has been submitted under the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2017 as amended. For consultation purposes only - The application will comprise an increase of 78 homes at Buildings A and C only (excluding Building B) from 335 to 413 homes delivered through an increase of two storeys to Buildings A3, A4, C1, C2 and C3 and an increase in 4 storeys to building A1 and A2. Total unit numbers 632 across the entire former B&Q Retail Warehouse site, 13 blocks in total.

An Environmental Statement has been submitted under the Town and Country Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations 2017 as amended. For consultation purposes only - The application will comprise an increase of 78 homes at Buildings A and C only (excluding Building B) from 335 to 413 homes delivered through an increase of two storeys to Buildings A3, A4, C1, C2 and C3 and an increase in 4 storeys to building A1 and A2.
